bill_title: to provide for certain scholarship programs and make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for certain scholarship programs and make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-55F-1 be amended to read as follows: 13-55F-1. There is established the Mickelson Scholars Program to be administered by the Board of Regents, which is hereby authorized to establish such policies and procedures as it deems necessary to carry out the purposes of this program. However, the Board of Regents may not award any Mickelson scholarships to any student who graduates from high school after Spring 1995. The purpose of the program is to encourage South Dakota's most academically accomplished high school graduates to remain in the state and to contribute to the economic development of the state. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the future fund created in § 61-5-24.2 the sum of two hundred sixteen thousand, two hundred eighty-three dollars ($216,283), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents to provide funding for the Mickelson Scholars Program created in chapter 13-55F. Section 3. The institution at which the recipient of a Mickelson Scholarship chooses to attend shall provide one-half of the amount of the recipient's Mickelson Scholarship amount. Section 4. There is hereby appropriated from the future fund created in § 61-5-24.2 the sum of one hundred ninety-one thousand three hundred fifty dollars ($191,350), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide state student incentive grants to qualified students in universities under the control of the Board of Regents pursuant to chapter 13-55A. Section 5. There is hereby appropriated from the future fund created in § 61-5-24.2 the sum of one hundred ninety-one thousand three hundred fifty dollars ($191,350), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural affairs to provide tuition equalization grants to qualified students in private colleges pursuant to chapter 13-55B. Section 6. There is hereby appropriated from the future fund created in § 61-5-24.2 the sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide for memorial cost equalization grants as provided by chapter 13-55G. Section 7. The executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by sections 2 to 4, inclusive, of this Act. Section 8. The secretary of the Department of Education shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by section 6 of this Act. Section 9. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 1999, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
